argument: The State was moreover entitled to prohibit activities because of their potential danger.

name: 20.txt
argument: In this respect, acts of torture - such as those in issue in the present case - may be banned also on the ground that they undermine the respect which human beings should confer upon each other.

argument: The concept of private life cannot be stretched indefinitely.

name: 20.txt
argument: Not every aspect of private life automatically qualifies for protection under the Convention.

name: 20.txt
argument: The fact that the behaviour concerned takes place on private premises does not suffice to ensure complete immunity and impunity.
